message:
Correctness_Score: 0.2
Style_Score: 0.8
Simplicity_Score: 0.4
Robustness_Score: 0.4
Reasoning: The BFS logic and path-length computation are correct in principle, but the nested O(N1 * N2) loop makes the solution infeasible for large inputs so it will time out on most full-range test cases. The code is readable with clear function/variable names and a helpful BFS docstring, though it lacks comments explaining the high-level approach. The implementation is straightforward but not concise or efficient — the double loop is unnecessary; the answer can be computed from the maximum distances on each side in linear time. It handles small and edge graphs correctly and uses safe data structures, but performance issues reduce its robustness for the full constraint set.
